1983 The Linda F. Segal collection of Brooklyn Bridge Centennial records contains press packets, memorabilia, and news clippings relating to the celebration.
Conditions Governing Access
Open to researchers without restriction.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Gift of Linda F. Segal, 2017.
Arrangement
Material has been grouped by subject type and arranged alphabetically.
Biographical / Historical
Linda F. Segal was the press agent for the Brooklyn Bridge Centennial Celebration, 1883-1983, planned by The 1983 Brooklyn Bridge Centennial Commission, Inc.
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date (if known); Linda F. Segal collection of Brooklyn Bridge Centennial records, 2017.024, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.
Processing Information
Records were housed in acid free folders and boxes. Folder titles were supplied by the archivist. Duplicate materials, clippings, and mass market publications were removed from the collection.

Scope and Contents
The Linda F. Segal collection of Brooklyn Bridge Centennial records contains news releases, invitations, pamphlets, programs, souvenir books, newspaper and magazine articles, and a catalog for The Great East River Bridge show at The Brooklyn Museum. All of the materials relate to the celebrations associated with the Brooklyn Bridge centennial celebration in 1983. The press materials, pamphlets, and souvenir books contain extensive information on the various events which comprised the Brooklyn Bridge Centennial Celebration. The invitations, pamphlets, and museum exhibition catalog document associated events. The press clippings include a reprint of the May 24, 1883, issue of The New York Times which included an article on the bridge's opening ceremony.
